description: Performs all the write operations in a batch. Either all the operations succeed or none.

parameters.name: DirectoryArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the  Directory. For more information, see  arns.

parameters.name: Operations
parameters.description: A list of operations that are part of the batch. (dict) --- Represents the output of a BatchWrite operation. CreateObject (dict) --- Creates an object. A list of FacetArns that will be associated with the object. For more information, see  arns. (dict) --- A facet. SchemaArn (string) --- The ARN of the schema that contains the facet with no minor component. See  arns and In-Place Schema Upgrade for a description of when to provide minor versions. If this value is set, FacetName must also be set. FacetName (string) --- The name of the facet. If this value is set, SchemaArn must also be set. An attribute map, which contains an attribute ARN as the key and attribute value as the map value. (dict) --- The combination of an attribute key and an attribute value. The key of the attribute. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema that contains the facet and attribute. The name of the facet that the attribute exists within. The name of the attribute. The value of the attribute. StringValue (string) --- A string data value. BinaryValue (bytes) --- A binary data value. BooleanValue (boolean) --- A Boolean data value. NumberValue (string) --- A number data value. DatetimeValue (datetime) --- A date and time value. ParentReference (dict) --- If specified, the parent reference to which this object will be attached. Selector (string) --- A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways: $ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object's identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier. To identify an object with ObjectIdentifier, the ObjectIdentifier must be wrapped in double quotes. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call LinkName (string) --- The name of the link. BatchReferenceName (string) --- The batch reference name. See Transaction Support for more information. AttachObject (dict) --- Attaches an object to a  Directory. The parent object reference. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call The child object reference that is to be attached to the object. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call The name of the link. DetachObject (dict) --- Detaches an object from a  Directory. Parent reference from which the object with the specified link name is detached. UpdateObjectAttributes (dict) --- Updates a given object's attributes. Reference that identifies the object. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call Attributes update structure. (dict) --- Structure that contains attribute update information. ObjectAttributeKey (dict) --- The key of the attribute being updated. ObjectAttributeAction (dict) --- The action to perform as part of the attribute update. ObjectAttributeActionType (string) --- A type that can be either Update or Delete. ObjectAttributeUpdateValue (dict) --- The value that you want to update to. DeleteObject (dict) --- Deletes an object in a  Directory. The reference that identifies the object. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call AddFacetToObject (dict) --- A batch operation that adds a facet to an object. Represents the facet being added to the object. The attributes to set on the object. A reference to the object being mutated. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call RemoveFacetFromObject (dict) --- A batch operation that removes a facet from an object. The facet to remove from the object. A reference to the object whose facet will be removed. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call AttachPolicy (dict) --- Attaches a policy object to a regular object. An object can have a limited number of attached policies. The reference that is associated with the policy object. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call The reference that identifies the object to which the policy will be attached. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call DetachPolicy (dict) --- Detaches a policy from a  Directory. Reference that identifies the policy object. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call Reference that identifies the object whose policy object will be detached. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call CreateIndex (dict) --- Creates an index object. See Indexing and search for more information. Specifies the attributes that should be indexed on. Currently only a single attribute is supported. (dict) --- A unique identifier for an attribute. Indicates whether the attribute that is being indexed has unique values or not. ParentReference (dict) --- A reference to the parent object that contains the index object. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call LinkName (string) --- The name of the link between the parent object and the index object. AttachToIndex (dict) --- Attaches the specified object to the specified index. A reference to the index that you are attaching the object to. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call A reference to the object that you are attaching to the index. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call DetachFromIndex (dict) --- Detaches the specified object from the specified index. A reference to the index object. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call A reference to the object being detached from the index. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call AttachTypedLink (dict) --- Attaches a typed link to a specified source and target object. For more information, see Typed Links. Identifies the source object that the typed link will attach to. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call Identifies the target object that the typed link will attach to. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call Identifies the typed link facet that is associated with the typed link. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. The unique name of the typed link facet. A set of attributes that are associated with the typed link. (dict) --- Identifies the attribute name and value for a typed link. The attribute name of the typed link. The value for the typed link. DetachTypedLink (dict) --- Detaches a typed link from a specified source and target object. Used to accept a typed link specifier as input. Identifies the typed link facet that is associated with the typed link. /some/path - Identifies the object based on path #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call Identifies the attribute value to update. UpdateLinkAttributes (dict) --- Updates a given object's attributes. Allows a typed link specifier to be accepted as input. The attributes update structure. AttributeKey (dict) --- The key of the attribute being updated. AttributeAction (dict) --- The action to perform as part of the attribute update. AttributeActionType (string) --- A type that can be either UPDATE_OR_CREATE or DELETE. AttributeUpdateValue (dict) --- The value that you want to update to. DatetimeValue (datetime) --- A date and time value.

nested_params.description: The name of the facet that the attribute exists within.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the attribute.

nested_params.name: AttributeAction
nested_params.description: The action to perform as part of the attribute update.

nested_params.name: AttributeActionType
nested_params.description: A type that can be either UPDATE_OR_CREATE or DELETE.

nested_params.name: AttributeUpdateValue
nested_params.description: The value that you want to update to.

nested_params.name: StringValue
nested_params.description: A string data value.

nested_params.name: BinaryValue
nested_params.description: A binary data value.

nested_params.name: BooleanValue
nested_params.description: A Boolean data value.

nested_params.name: NumberValue
nested_params.description: A number data value.

nested_params.name: DatetimeValue
nested_params.description: A date and time value.

nested_items.name: Responses
nested_items.description: A list of all the responses for each batch write.

nested_items.name: CreateObject
nested_items.description: Creates an object in a  Directory.

nested_items.name: ObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ID that is associated with the object.

nested_items.name: AttachObject
nested_items.description: Attaches an object to a  Directory.

nested_items.name: attachedObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ObjectIdentifier of the object that has been attached.

nested_items.name: DetachObject
nested_items.description: Detaches an object from a  Directory.

nested_items.name: detachedObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ObjectIdentifier of the detached object.

nested_items.name: UpdateObjectAttributes
nested_items.description: Updates a given object's attributes.

nested_items.name: ObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: ID that is associated with the object.

nested_items.name: DeleteObject
nested_items.description: Deletes an object in a  Directory.

nested_items.name: AddFacetToObject
nested_items.description: The result of an add facet to object batch operation.

nested_items.name: RemoveFacetFromObject
nested_items.description: The result of a batch remove facet from object operation.

nested_items.name: AttachPolicy
nested_items.description: Attaches a policy object to a regular object. An object can have a limited number of attached policies.

nested_items.name: DetachPolicy
nested_items.description: Detaches a policy from a  Directory.

nested_items.name: CreateIndex
nested_items.description: Creates an index object. See Indexing and search for more information.

nested_items.name: ObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ObjectIdentifier of the index created by this operation.

nested_items.name: AttachToIndex
nested_items.description: Attaches the specified object to the specified index.

nested_items.name: AttachedObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ObjectIdentifier of the object that was attached to the index.

nested_items.name: DetachFromIndex
nested_items.description: Detaches the specified object from the specified index.

nested_items.name: DetachedObjectIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ObjectIdentifier of the object that was detached from the index.

nested_items.name: AttachTypedLink
nested_items.description: Attaches a typed link to a specified source and target object. For more information, see Typed Links.

nested_items.name: TypedLinkSpecifier
nested_items.description: Returns a typed link specifier as output.

nested_items.name: TypedLinkFacet
nested_items.description: Identifies the typed link facet that is associated with the typed link.

nested_items.name: SchemaArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see  arns.

nested_items.name: TypedLinkName
nested_items.description: The unique name of the typed link facet.

nested_items.name: SourceObjectReference
nested_items.description: Identifies the source object that the typed link will attach to.

nested_items.name: Selector
nested_items.description: A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

$ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object's identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier. To identify an object with ObjectIdentifier, the ObjectIdentifier must be wrapped in double quotes.
/some/path - Identifies the object based on path.
#SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call.

nested_items.name: TargetObjectReference
nested_items.description: Identifies the target object that the typed link will attach to.

nested_items.name: Selector
nested_items.description: A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

$ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object's identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier. To identify an object with ObjectIdentifier, the ObjectIdentifier must be wrapped in double quotes.
/some/path - Identifies the object based on path.
#SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call.

nested_items.name: IdentityAttributeValues
nested_items.description: Identifies the attribute value to update.

nested_items.name: AttributeName
nested_items.description: The attribute name of the typed link.

nested_items.name: StringValue
nested_items.description: A string data value.

nested_items.name: BinaryValue
nested_items.description: A binary data value.

nested_items.name: BooleanValue
nested_items.description: A Boolean data value.

nested_items.name: NumberValue
nested_items.description: A number data value.

nested_items.name: DatetimeValue
nested_items.description: A date and time value.

nested_items.name: DetachTypedLink
nested_items.description: Detaches a typed link from a specified source and target object. For more information, see Typed Links.

nested_items.name: UpdateLinkAttributes
nested_items.description: Represents the output of a BatchWrite response operation.
